modules.description: Provides DNS client operations including connecting to nameservers, sending and receiving DNS queries, and managing context resources. Works with DNS protocols, network addresses, and Lwt-based asynchronous I/O structures. Used to establish reliable DNS communication, generate random values for query IDs, and manage timeouts and resource cleanup.

handles DNS communication through asynchronous I/O, enabling query sending, response receiving, and context management. it operates on network addresses, DNS protocol structures, and Lwt threads, supporting query ID generation and timeout handling. it facilitates reliable name resolution by managing resources and ensuring proper cleanup. examples include resolving domain names, handling DNSSEC validation, and implementing custom query logic.

Handles email verification and signing using DKIM protocols, supporting cryptographic operations for message integrity and authentication. Works with email message structures, including headers and bodies, and cryptographic keys. Used to filter incoming SMTP traffic for verification or to sign outgoing emails before submission.

manages DNS communication using asynchronous I/O, handling queries, responses, and context management with support for DNS protocol structures and Lwt. it processes network addresses, generates query IDs, and manages timeouts to ensure reliable resolution. operations include DNSSEC validation, custom query implementation, and domain name resolution. examples include resolving MX records, validating DNS responses, and managing query timeouts.
